sentences: Ta on mitu kannu õlut hinge alla pannud, visanud.
Pistis taldrikutäie kuuma suppi hinge alla.
context: Hinge is the partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'hing', which means 'soul' or 'breath'. In this context, it's used with the preposition 'alla' (down) to indicate the action of consuming food or drink. This expression literally translates as 'into the soul/breath down' and is commonly used when talking about eating or drinking something quickly or eagerly.
